4.8 Chemical-specific Prevention Steps - Process chemicals

Industry standards are followed at The Little Rock Water Reclamation Authority Fourche Creek Water Reclamation Facility to help ensure safe handling of process chemicals. The vendor supplies chlorine and sulfur dioxide via a Department of Transportation (DOT) approved truck and in DOT approved 1 ton cylinders. The process equipment is designed and constructed with state-of-the-art materials and technology utilizing the standards and guidelines of the Chlorine Institute, American Water Works Association, ASME, ANSI, and other applicable codes. Workers who perform operations involving chlorine and sulfur dioxide receive training emphasizing safe handling procedures according to the guidelines required by The Little Rock Water Reclamation Authority Fourche Creek Water Reclamation Facility.

5.0 Five Year Accident History
There has been no accidents or incidents that resulted in injuries to employee, the public, or the environment at The Little Rock Water Reclamation Authority Fourche Creek Water Reclamation Facility in the past five years.

6.0 Emergency Response 

The Little Rock Water Reclamation Authority Fourche Creek Water Reclamation Facility has prepared a written emergency response/action plan that complies with the RMP Rule, other federal standards and industry guidelines.  This plan has been communicated to the Local Emergency Planning Committee LEPC/EMA and local fire department under the coordination rules of the RMP.

4.6 Compliance Audits

A compliance audit report is prepared after each audit, and any deficiencies noted by the audit are corrected in a timely manner.

RISK MANAGEMENT PROGRAM
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.0	Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The Little Rock Water Reclamation Authority Fourche Creek Water Reclamation Facility is committed to the safety of our workers, the public, and the environment. The resources invested in the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances demonstrate this commitment. The Little Rock Water Reclamation Authority Fourche Creek Water Reclamation Facility implements reasonable controls, such as training of personnel and the safe design, installation, operation and maintenance of our processes. Our policy is to make every effort to prevent the release of hazardous substances but in the event of a release, our trained personnel will coordinate with local emergency response agencies and first responders to control and contain the release in a manner that will be safe for workers and will help prevent injuries to the public or the environment.

2.0 Description of The Little Rock Water Reclamation Authority Fourche Creek Water Reclamation Facility and Regulated Substances

The Little Rock Water Reclamation Authority Fourche Creek Water Reclamation Facility handles two substances regulated by the Risk Management Plan Rule (RMP Rule) in quantities above the Threshold Quantity. These substances are:

* Chlorine - stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for disinfection of the water.
* Sulfur dioxide- stored in 1 ton cylinders and used for dechlorination of water.
